collectors.title: Database
collectors.titleDetails: (24 total Queries, 24 of them unique across 1 Connection)

queries.sql: INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>1. Obtain a schedule of provisions, contingent assets, contingent liabilities and financial commitments showing the movement for each provision in the period. <strong>(P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>2. Regarding provisions agree the total shown on the lead schedule to the trial balance. <strong>(E)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>3. Regarding provisions agree comparative figures and regarding contingencies comparative disclosures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>4. Review provisions, contingent assets, contingent liabilities and financial commitments for reasonableness and consistency.<strong> (C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>5. Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>6. Discuss with management to ensure all appropriate provisions have been included in the financial statements and that appropriate disclosure has been made of contingent liabilities and contingent assets. Confirm findings in the letter of representation. Ensure additional key findings from this section are included on the points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>7. Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong> (P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>8. Confirm that provisions have only been recognised when:</p> <ul> <li>an entity has a present obligation as a result of a past event; and</li> <li>it is probable that a transfer of economic benefits is required to settle the obligation; and</li> <li>a reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation. <strong>(P)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>9. Confirm that contingent liabilities have been disclosed when:</p> <ul> <li>an entity has a present obligation as a result of a past event; and</li> <li>it is probable that a transfer of economic benefits is required to settle the obligation, however a reliable estimate cannot be made of the amount of the obligation; or</li> <li>it is only possible (but not remote) that a transfer of economic benefits is required.<strong> (P)</strong></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>10. Confirm that a contingent asset has been disclosed when an inflow as a result of a past event of economic benefit is probable. <strong> (P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>11. Check provisions to supporting documentation ensuring that provisions represents the present value (if the time value of money is material) of the best estimate of the liability. (Specific consideration should be given to the discounting rate applied). <strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>12. Verify expenditure charged against provisions to supporting documentation to confirm that the expenditure is for the purpose for which the provision was originally established. <strong>(R&O, A,P)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>13. Where provisions have not been utilised and have been released to the profit or loss section of the Statement of Comprehensive Income, ascertain the reasons why and consider whether this draws into question the reliability of any other provisions.<strong> (E, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>14. Ascertain whether all necessary provisions have been made and contingencies disclosed by considering, for example:</p> <ul> <li>litigation and claims ;</li> <li>deferred tax (see the J Section);</li> <li>dilapidations;</li> <li>product warranty provisions</li> <li>rectification provisions (see the E Section);</li> <li>onerous contracts; and</li> <li>pension commitments. <strong>(C, P)</strong></li> <li></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>15. Review:</p> <ul> <li>shareholder and board minutes; </li> <li>correspondence and invoices received from solicitors;</li> <li>correspondence from regulatory authorities; to identify whether there are any ongoing matters which may lead to additional provisions or contingent liabilities. <strong> (C)</strong></li> <li></li> </ul>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>16. Ensure that specific confirmation is obtained in the letter of representation that all litigation and claims have been notified to the auditors. <strong> (C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>17. Where potential provisions or contingent liabilities have been identified, write to the legal adviser dealing with the matter, setting out a list of known litigation and claims, including management’s assessment of the outcome of each case, and request confirmation that management’s assessment is reasonable, and if there is any further information that the auditor should consider (see Proforma Documents / Appendix 8). <strong> (C, R&O, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>18. Ensure that reimbursements are only recognised when it is virtually certain that they will be received. <strong> (V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>19. Where a provision (other than deferred tax) has been discounted, ensure the unwinding of the provision is appropriately accounted for in the profit or loss section of the Statement of Comprehensive Income as a finance cost. <strong> (P, V)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>20. Enquire into the existence of any forward exchange contracts. Where they exist obtain a counterparty valuation and agree them to market valuations such as those that can be obtained via premium subscription. Ensure that an appropriate liability or asset has been recognised and complete the hedging audit programme where the client has opted to hedge account. <strong>(P, E,C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>21. Enquire into the existence of non-basic financial instruments (other than forward exchange contracts, non-basic bank loans and interest rate swaps). Where they exist obtain a counterparty valuation and then obtain an expert valuation and complete the relevant tests on the N audit programme. Ensure that an appropriate liability or asset has been recognised and complete the hedging audit programme where the client has opted to hedge account. <strong>(P, E,C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>22. If, during the audit work, there is any suspicion that a document may not be authentic, or has been altered, consider confirming the contents of the document directly with the third party from whom the document originated. <strong>(E, R&O, C)</strong></p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

INSERT INTO `tbl_c2` (`question`, `extent`, `reference`, `initials`, `type`, `code`, `c2tID`, `status`, `updated_on`) VALUES ('<p>23. List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>', '', '', '', '2.10 L2', '2.10 L2', '28', 'Active', '2024-03-21 16:35:12')

params.name: $head =
params.value: Provisions Contingencies and Commitments Audit Programme

post.question:
Array
(
    [0] => <p>1.	Obtain a schedule of provisions, contingent assets, contingent liabilities and financial commitments showing the movement for each provision in the period.  <strong>(P)</strong></p>
    [1] => <p>2.	Regarding provisions agree the total shown on the lead schedule to the trial balance. <strong>(E)</strong></p>
    [2] => <p>3.	Regarding provisions agree comparative figures and regarding contingencies comparative disclosures to the previous period’s statutory financial statements. <strong>(V)</strong></p>
    [3] => <p>4.	Review provisions, contingent assets, contingent liabilities and financial commitments for reasonableness and consistency.<strong> (C)</strong></p>
    [4] => <p>5.	Revisit the risk assessment, materiality calculation and assignment plan and update as appropriate where matters have been identified during the assignment.</p>
    [5] => <p>6.	Discuss with management to ensure all appropriate provisions have been included in the financial statements and that appropriate disclosure has been made of contingent liabilities and contingent assets.  Confirm findings in the letter of representation.  Ensure additional key findings from this section are included on the points for the management letter and points for A.E.P.’s attention.</p>
    [6] => <p>7.	Ensure that the conclusion is appropriate. <strong> (P)</strong></p>
    [7] => <p>8.	Confirm that provisions have only been recognised when:</p>
<ul>
    <li>an entity has a present obligation as a result of a past event; and</li>
    <li>it is probable that a transfer of economic benefits is required to settle the obligation; and</li>
    <li>a reliable estimate can be made of the amount of the obligation. <strong>(P)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [8] => <p>9.	Confirm that contingent liabilities have been disclosed when:</p>
<ul>
    <li>an entity has a present obligation as a result of a past event; and</li>
    <li>it is probable that a transfer of economic benefits is required to settle the obligation, however a reliable estimate cannot be made of the amount of the obligation; or</li>
    <li>it is only possible (but not remote) that a transfer of economic benefits is required.<strong> (P)</strong></li>
</ul>
    [9] => <p>10.	Confirm that a contingent asset has been disclosed when an inflow as a result of a past event of economic benefit is probable. <strong> (P)</strong></p>
    [10] => <p>11.	Check provisions to supporting documentation ensuring that provisions represents the present value (if the time value of money is material) of the best estimate of the liability. (Specific consideration should be given to the discounting rate applied). <strong> (V)</strong></p>
    [11] => <p>12.	Verify expenditure charged against provisions to supporting documentation to confirm that the expenditure is for the purpose for which the provision was originally established. <strong>(R&O, A,P)</strong></p>
    [12] => <p>13.	Where provisions have not been utilised and have been released to the profit or loss section of the Statement of Comprehensive Income, ascertain the reasons why and consider whether this draws into question the reliability of any other provisions.<strong> (E, V)</strong></p>
    [13] => <p>14.	Ascertain whether all necessary provisions have been made and contingencies disclosed by considering, for example:</p>
<ul>
    <li>litigation and claims ;</li>
    <li>deferred tax (see the J Section);</li>
    <li>dilapidations;</li>
    <li>product warranty provisions</li>
    <li>rectification provisions (see the E Section);</li>
    <li>onerous contracts; and</li>
    <li>pension commitments.  <strong>(C, P)</strong></li>
    <li></li>
</ul>
    [14] => <p>15.	Review:</p>
<ul>
    <li>shareholder and board minutes; </li>
    <li>correspondence and invoices received from solicitors;</li>
    <li>correspondence from regulatory authorities; to identify whether there are any ongoing matters which may lead to additional provisions or contingent liabilities. <strong> (C)</strong></li>
    <li></li>
</ul>
    [15] => <p>16.	Ensure that specific confirmation is obtained in the letter of representation that all litigation and claims have been notified to the auditors. <strong> (C)</strong></p>
    [16] => <p>17.	Where potential provisions or contingent liabilities have been identified, write to the legal adviser dealing with the matter, setting out a list of known litigation and claims, including management’s assessment of the outcome of each case, and request confirmation that management’s assessment is reasonable, and if there is any further information that the auditor should consider (see Proforma Documents / Appendix 8). <strong> (C, R&O, V)</strong></p>
    [17] => <p>18.	Ensure that reimbursements are only recognised when it is virtually certain that they will be received. <strong> (V)</strong></p>
    [18] => <p>19.	Where a provision (other than deferred tax) has been discounted, ensure the unwinding of the provision is appropriately accounted for in the profit or loss section of the Statement of Comprehensive Income as a finance cost. <strong> (P, V)</strong></p>
    [19] => <p>20.	Enquire into the existence of any forward exchange contracts. Where they exist obtain a counterparty valuation and agree them to market valuations such as those that can be obtained via premium subscription.  Ensure that an appropriate liability or asset has been recognised and complete the hedging audit programme where the client has opted to hedge account. <strong>(P, E,C)</strong></p>
    [20] => <p>21.	Enquire into the existence of non-basic financial instruments (other than forward exchange contracts, non-basic bank loans and interest rate swaps). Where they exist obtain a counterparty valuation and then obtain an expert valuation and complete the relevant tests on the N audit programme.  Ensure that an appropriate liability or asset has been recognised and complete the hedging audit programme where the client has opted to hedge account.  <strong>(P, E,C)</strong></p>
    [21] => <p>22.	If, during the audit work, there is any suspicion that a document may not be authentic, or has been altered, consider confirming the contents of the document directly with the third party from whom the document originated. <strong>(E, R&O, C)</strong></p>
    [22] => <p>23.	List and perform any additional tests considered necessary.</p>
)
